definition: Republic of Korea (South Korea)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han
surname Min
the people/nationality/citizen

country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The Republic of Korea deserves our full support.
sentences.chinese: 大韩民国值得我们的全力支持。

sentences.english: The Republic of Korea has made extraordinary progress.
sentences.chinese: 大韩民国取得了非凡的进步。

sentences.english: I like the Republic of Korea.
It has leaders who care about the well-being of the people.
sentences.chinese: 大韩民国有关心人民福祉的领导人。

sentences.english: Dr Lee was the first UN agency head from the Republic of Korea.
sentences.chinese: 李博士是来自大韩民国的第一位联合国机构首长。

sentences.english: It has a commitment to common values of democracy and freedom.
sentences.chinese: 大韩民国有坚定的意志维护民主与自由的共同价值观。

sentences.english: It has an economy that is growing and creating jobs and opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 大韩民国有日益增长和不断创造就业和机会的经济。
